page.title: 04FARMING TOFTWOOD WESTFIELD
page.content: 3 of the farms in our survey had large dairy herds totalling 382 cattle and 4 of the farms had pig units which totalled 3,025 pigs. All of the farms had existed for over 150 years and many of the farmers still lived in the original farmhouse. Nowadays these buildings are surrounded by large industrial units to house machinery. The traditional field pattern has virtually disappeared and many hedgerows have been uprooted to take the new machinery. The average size of a field in this area is now 18 acres. Despite the many changes in farming methods, the seasons are still important to the farmers as they all reported that their busiest time was between August and September and the quietest time was between January and March.
